item.title: What Does -1 Ante -1 Hand Each Round Mean in Balatro? Hieroglyph Voucher Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/what-does-1-ante-1-hand-each-round-mean-in-balatro-hieroglyph-voucher-explained/

If you’ve come across the Hieroglyph Voucher in Balatro and are unsure what it does, you’re in the right place. It stumped me, and my heart sank when I realized the full extent of what it did. Let’s avoid the same mistake happening to you.

Early games of Balatro are understandably a lot to take in. Jokers, Card Enhancements, Planets, Spectral modifiers, etc. But Balatro’s Hieroglyph Shop Voucher is a perfect example of how a simple misunderstanding can bring a run crumbling down. I took this the first time it appeared, having a vague idea of what it would do, and it didn’t help.

With greater understanding, I now know Hieroglyph’s full value and worth. Let me pass this knowledge on.

What Does Hieroglyph Voucher Do In Balatro?

Buying the Hieroglyph Voucher reduces your Ante by one, but you have one fewer Hand for every subsequent Blind you come up against from this point on.

-1 Ante Explained

When you start a game of Balatro, you are immediately on Ante One of eight. If you beat the Boss Blind—after the Small and Big Blind—you progress to Ante Two, and so on.

Let’s say you’ve beaten the Small Blind on Ante Four. You go to the Shop and purchase Hieroglyph, and your Ante counter now changes to Ante Three. You have gone back a whole Ante!

-1 Hand Explained

The default Hands you start with is usually four. Different Decks can change this, but by and large, you’re going to start with four. A Hand is the amount of times you’re allowed to submit cards in exchange for a score.

So, if you buy Hieroglyph and have four Hands available, this tally goes down to three. You now only have three chances to score points for any Blind you come up against.

Should You Use -1 Ante -1 Hand Hieroglyph Voucher in Balatro?

Hieroglyph should only be procured if you have an extremely effective strategy and you’re obliterating every Blind with a single hand.

The Voucher is designed so that if your setup is OP, you get another Ante to make it even stronger. If you’re already destroying Blinds in one or two goes, losing a Hand won’t affect you.

You can also try Hieroglpyh if you’re struggling and desperately need something to turn your run around. This is very risky, and losing a Hand could sign your death sentence. The Paint Brush (+1 Hand Size) and Palette (+1 Hand Size again) Shop Vouchers are incredible additions to your arsenal if you can get them.

They negate the consequence of losing a Hand and can give you a clean reset. I pick and choose my Hieroglyph usage—mainly for those OP runs—but it’s a great tool to be more powerful and take your run into Endless Mode.

How often do you take Hieroglyph in Balatro? Are there any other scenarios you’d suggest buying the Voucher I haven’t already outlined?

Improve your Balatro sense with even more handy tips and guides: How to unlock the Throwback, Astronomer, and Hit The Road Jokers, as well as how to beat The Plant Boss Blind, and what the Blank Voucher does.

item.title: Marvel Rivals is Seemingly Receiving a Bunch of X-Men Characters
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-x-men-characters/

According to new leaks, Marvel Rivals seems to want to increase the number of X-Men in their roster. 

Spotted by Videogamer, a series of posts from X0X_LEAK has revealed a bunch of new X-Men that may arrive in Marvel Rivals in the near future. Per the leak, Gambit, Rogue, Jubilee, Beast and Nightcrawler will join the mix. Gambit is a Duelist, Rouge is a strategist, and Nightcrawler is a Duelist. The classes of Beast and Jubilee are unknown. 

With the previous leak of characters like Professor X and Jia Jing joining Marvel Rivals, it seems a total of 8 new X-Men will be added to the collection. The game already consists of 5 X-Men in the original roster, which includes Magic, Magneto, Psylocke, Storm and Wolverine. 

Moreover, X0X_LEAK has also revealed the expected abilities of the new X-Men coming to Marvel Rivals. Check out the complete list below. 

  • Professor X: X-Men Collection, Potential stimulation and Mind projection
  • Jia Jing: Fairy Wings and Fairy Healing
  • Paste Pot Pete: Sticky bomb, Glue lasso and Pay attention to your feet
  • Colossus: Giant Punch and Steel Colossus
  • Locus: Unstable structure, Stable structure and Energy lock
  • Beast: Dexterity, Field Experiment and Intelligence analysis
  • Nightcrawler: Foil style, Epee Style and Phase shift
  • Jubilee: Fireworks, Atomic Bomb and Atomic Bomb-Excitation
  • Rogue: Ability to draw, Ability Acquisition-Skill One, Ability Acquisition-Skill Two and Ability Acquisition-Skill Three
  • Gambit: Kinetic Energy Card, Energy accumulation, Node Card Array-Projection and Node Card Array-Recycling

In other news, Marvel Rivals’ new spring event has added a Rocket League-like game mode. Also, check out what is Supermaster V in the game. What are your thoughts on the leaked X-Men characters for Marvel Rivals? Let us know in the comments below or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the new Pokemon TCG Pocket x McDonald’s collaboration. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: What is Supermaster V in Marvel Rivals? Ranked Bug Explained
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/supermaster-v-marvel-rivals-ranked-bug-explained/

The Supermaster V ranked bug is a literal marvel in Marvel Rivals. You’d think it has positive connotations and signifies progress in Rivals, but it’s a strange occurrence with drastic outcomes for ranked matches.

Marvel Rivals ranked mode is where the elite go to fight. It’s where the dedicated want to prove themselves and ascend to higher levels of greatness, before eventually applying to join the Avengers. With Shroud looking at starting a Rivals Esports organization and the game’s director already discussing Esports plans, ranked is the first step on the road to major competitive play.

However, Marvel Rivals ranked play is being impacted by a Supermaster V bug. Let’s take a look at everything we know about it and what it does.

What Causes Supermaster V Bug in Marvel Rivals?

The Supermaster V is a post-game bug happening when a ranked match is considered invalid—due to insufficient players, AFK action, or forfeiting.

These issues can be attributed to connection issues, users being idle, or rage-quitting. In short, if your ranked match goes off without a hitch, it’s sure to be a valid encounter where everything is presented and shown as normal. If any of the above happens, Supermaster V may land to spoil your day.

It only appears at the end of a Marvel Rivals ranked match, and I can confirm it’s not one of the official tiers in the Rivals ranked system.

NetEase has yet to formally address the Supermaster V error. We’re trying to piece together what we can from various players’ experiences. You can see X user @whyAndr3w‘s game above where they encountered the bug and posted about it.

Does Supermaster V Bug Change Your Online Rank in Marvel Rivals?

Your online rank being affected by Supermaster V is inconclusive, but based on what we’ve seen, it doesn’t appear you are penalized too heavily if it happens.

Anyone in an invalid lobby who is hit by the Supermaster V bug is susceptible to an AFK ban. It’s not confirmed to be a guarantee, but I’ve seen several examples of players complaining about this.

Steam user EXtremist said, “The game shows me a Supermaster [V] message, after winning, and then I get a 15-minute penalty for being disconnected, which never happened. This is [the] 3rd time.” Another Steam player shared their story, “I was in a ranked game and everyone had poor connection midway through. I hit 1000 ping at one point, [and] at the end I got the ranked progress, it says 20/30, and the rank was Supermaster V.”

Not every case seems to be the same though. JDlyndon on the Marvel Rivals subreddit shared a picture of the Supermaster V screen. They said they “Played and won a game of competitive and instead of getting a normal ranked points gain screen I got this.” They add “There was no AFK in the match” and it went down like a normal ranked match.

Again, the findings aren’t absolute right now. Keep checking back as we find out the latest on Supermaster V, and if NetEase comments.

Have you had Supermaster V happen to you after playing a Marvel Rivals ranked match? Did you get an AFK ban? Have you lost any ranking points as a result?

We have more Marvel Guides including how to Trigger Recursive Destruction and Spider-Tracer, and news of The Thing & Human Torch’s release.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket x McDonald’s Promotion is Offering Rewards Through Happy Meals
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-tcg-pocket-mcdonalds-promotion-happy-meals/

Pokemon and McDonald’s have announced a new collaboration, which includes free TCG Pocket rewards when purchasing the latter’s latest Happy Meal line. 

As a part of the collaboration, a Pokemon Happy Meal was announced with Dragon-themed artwork. The new Pokemon Happy Meal artwork features Charizard, Pikachu & Dragonite, Rayquaza, and Roaring Moon. Inside the box, players will find “a Pokémon TCG booster pack featuring four of 15 available Pokémon TCG cards, a Pokémon poster, and one sticker sheet to decorate the poster.” Additional rewards for Pokemon TCG Pocket can be claimed through the McDonald’s app.

How to claim Pokemon TCG Pocket Rewards from the McDonald’s app?

To claim the rewards for Pokemon TCG Pocket, players will have to follow these steps: 

  • First, download the McDonald’s application and then head to settings. Here, players “must opt-in to email before purchase” to receive the rewards for Pokemon TCG Pocket. 
  • Then, through the McDonald’s app, players can order a Pokemon Happy Meal. 
  • As soon as the order has been placed, players will receive an email with a gift code for the Pokemon TCG Pocket App and a link to access the rewards. 
  • Once you click the link, you must feed your code/Support ID on the rewards website to claim your rewards. 
  • Once claimed, the rewards will be sent to the Gifts section of the Pokemon TCG Pocket App. 

Pokemon TCG Pocket x McDonald’s collaboration will reward you with x24 Pack Hourglasses, which allows players to open two packs of 5 cards, or you will receive x12 Wonder Hourglasses, which lets you claim one random card. Players should know that the offer expires on March 31, 2025, and is only available in the United States. 

In other news, check out Pokemon TCG Pocket’s upcoming trading feature. Also, it was claimed that Pokemon Legends Z-A isn’t a Switch 2 game. What are your thoughts on the Pokemon TCG Pocket x McDonald’s collaboration? Let us know in the comments below or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Phantom Blade Zero’s new gameplay trailer. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
